snippet: The Federal Reserve reported that American consumers increased their borrowing by $13.8 billion in June, mostly with auto and student loans.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that consumers increased their borrowing by $13.8 billion in June from May, to seasonally adjusted $2.85 trillion; borrowing for autos and student loans rises, but category including credit card use drops $2.7 billion.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve reported that American consumers increased their borrowing by $13.8 billion in June, mostly with auto and student loans.

headline.main: Borrowing by Consumers Rose in June, Fed Reports
headline.print_headline: Borrowing By Consumers Rose in June, Fed Reports
